text.section: A corporation may acquire all of the outstanding shares of one (1) or more classes or series of another corporation if the board of directors of each corporation adopts and its shareholders (if required by KRS 271B.11-030) approve the exchange.

The plan of exchange shall set forth:
The name of the corporation whose shares will be acquired and the name of the acquiring corporation;
The terms and conditions of the exchange; and
The manner and basis of exchanging the shares to be acquired for shares, obligations, or other securities of the acquiring or any other corporation or for cash or other property in whole or part.
The plan of exchange may set forth other provisions relating to the exchange.
This section shall not limit the power of a corporation to acquire all or part of the shares of one (1) or more classes or series of another corporation through a voluntary exchange or otherwise.

law.history: Created 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 23, sec. 115, effective January 1, 1989.
